dates.fun_fact: The Berlin Wall fell in 1989, symbolizing the end of the Cold War and German reunification.
On July 4, 1776, the United States declared independence from Britain.

wars.name: World War I
wars.fun_fact: World War I was known as 'The Great War' and introduced trench warfare.

wars.name: World War II
wars.fun_fact: World War II was the deadliest conflict in history, involving over 30 countries.

figures.name: Napoleon Bonaparte
figures.fun_fact: Napoleon crowned himself Emperor of France in 1804 and was exiled twice.

figures.name: Cleopatra
figures.fun_fact: Cleopatra was the last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt.

concepts.definition: Process by which plants convert light into energy
concepts.fun_fact: Photosynthesis takes place in chloroplasts using chlorophyll.

concepts.definition: Force that pulls objects toward each other
concepts.fun_fact: Isaac Newton formulated the law of universal gravitation in 1687.

scientists.name: Albert Einstein
scientists.fun_fact: Einstein won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921 for the photoelectric effect.

scientists.name: Isaac Newton
scientists.fun_fact: Newton also invented calculus and built the first reflecting telescope.

inventions.name: Microscope
inventions.fun_fact: The first microscope was invented in the late 16th century in the Netherlands.

inventions.name: Telescope
inventions.fun_fact: Galileo used the telescope in 1609 to observe the moons of Jupiter.

rivers.name: Nile
rivers.fun_fact: The Nile flows through 11 countries in Africa and ends in Egypt.

rivers.name: Amazon
rivers.fun_fact: The Amazon River discharges more water than the next 7 largest rivers combined.

mountains.name: Mount Everest
mountains.fun_fact: Mount Everest is still growing by about 4mm per year due to tectonic activity.

mountains.name: K2
mountains.fun_fact: K2 is considered more dangerous to climb than Everest due to its severe weather.

countries.name: Canada
countries.fun_fact: Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.

countries.name: Japan
countries.fun_fact: Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands, the largest being Honshu.
